data.title: Snail in a hole
data.solution:
import sys
import math

# Auto-generated code below aims at helping you parse
# the standard input according to the problem statement.

d = int(input())
x = int(input())
y = int(input())

#Simple Solution:

if x<=y and d>x:
    print("Impossible")
elif d<=x:
    print(1)
else:
    print(str( math.ceil( (d-y)/(x-y) ) ))
data.statement:
A snail fell inside a [[d]]-meter deep hole. Fortunately for it, the snail can go up the walls of the hole. At daylight it can go up [[x]] meters. However the snail needs to sleep at night, so it will slide down [[y]] meters. If the snail manages to reach the top during daylight it <<does not>>
 need to slide down the [[y]] meters since it will be out of the hole. E.g. if it can climb 5 meters at daylight, slides down 10 meters during the night and needs to go up by 3 meters it can still escape the hole during the same day, since its journey starts at the starts at daylight and in this case the snail will have escaped before night. The task is to output on which day the snail will escape the hole (only count the days not the nights; if result is a float, round up).

testCases.title: Test 7 - It's a crack, not a hole

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A snail fell inside a d-meter deep hole. Fortunately for it, the snail can go up the walls of the hole. At daylight it can go up x meters. However the snail needs to sleep at night, so it will slide down y meters. If the snail manages to reach the top during daylight it does not
need to slide down the y meters since it will be out of the hole. E.g. if it can climb 5 meters at daylight, slides down 10 meters during the night and needs to go up by 3 meters it can still escape the hole during the same day, since its journey starts at the starts at daylight and in this case the snail will have escaped before night. The task is to output on which day the snail will escape the hole (only count the days not the nights; if result is a float, round up).
Input
Line 1: An integer d depth of the hole
Line 2: An integer x for the distance travelled during the day
Line 3: An integer y for the distance the snail slides down during the night night
Output
Line 1: An Integer for the number of the day the snail will escape - if it is not possible to escape, output the String "Impossible"
Constraints
0 < x,y < 1000
0 < d < 1000000
Example
Input
10
3
2
Output
8
